Key Match Events: Shota Imanaga gave up two runs in the first, but the Cubs' seven-run second inning helped him get through six innings, giving up just three runs on four hits while striking out eight and walking just one.
Cody Bellinger capped off the second inning with a two-run shot, giving the Cubs all the runs they'd score on the night.
Nate Pearson relieved Imanaga in the seventh and faced the minimum — giving up one hit and striking out two — in two scoreless frames.
Keegan Thompson came in to face the recently called-up Dylan Crews with the tying and winning runs on base and two outs, getting him to swing through a curveball to end the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Craig Counsell is known for his September runs — and he’s just one day away from his month.
Counsell emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance in the win.
The Cubs started the second inning with four straight hits, including a two-RBI double by Pete Crow-Armstrong that put the team up a run.
Post-Match Reflections: Counsell praised Nate Pearson for his performance in the seventh and eighth innings, calling it a 'big two innings for sure'.
Counsell also praised Keegan Thompson for coming in a tough spot and making some tough pitches.
Counsell said the team will continue to compete until the end of the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs picked up Shawn Armstrong, who was designated for assignment by the St. Louis Cardinals, to provide bullpen reinforcements.
Counsell said the team has never stopped competing, despite some questioning their desire to compete.
The Cubs are playing as well as they have all season, but it may be too little, too late to catch Atlanta in the wild-card race.
Others: The team is 69-66 and five games back in the wild-card standings, but have won four straight and 10 of 13 games.
Counsell wasn't going to use Jorge López Friday night due to his groin injury, but expects him to be available this weekend.
The Cubs may use Jordan Wicks as a starter this weekend, but Javier Assad will pitch Saturday evening.
